==Events==
*[[480 BC]] &ndash; [[Greeks]] defeat [[Achaemenid Empire|Persians]] in the [[Battle of Salamis]]
* [[622]]  &ndash; [[Muhammad]] and [[Abu Bakr]] arrived [[Medina]]
*[[1058]] &ndash; [[Agnes de Poitou]] and [[Andrew I of Hungary]] meet to negotiate about the border-zone in present-day [[Burgenland]].
*[[1066]] &ndash; [[Battle of Fulford]], Viking [[Harold Hardrada]] defeats earls [[Morcar]] and [[Edwin]] (both died in the battle)
*[[1187]] &ndash; [[Saladin]] begins the [[Siege of Jerusalem (1187)|Siege of Jerusalem]].
*[[1260]] &ndash; the [[Great Prussian Uprising]] among the [[old Prussians]] begins against the [[Teutonic Knights]].
*[[1378]] &ndash; [[Cardinal (Catholicism)|Cardinal]] [[Antipope Clement VII|Robert of Geneva]], called by some the "Butcher of Cesena", is elected as Avignon Pope Clement VII, beginning the [[Papal schism]].
*[[1498]] &ndash; The [[1498 Meiō Nankaidō earthquake]] generates a [[tsunami]] that washes away the building housing the statue of the [[Amitābha|Great Buddha]] at [[Kōtoku-in]] in [[Kamakura, Kanagawa]], Japan; since then the Buddha has sat in the open air.
*[[1519]] &ndash; [[Ferdinand Magellan]] sets sail from [[Sanlúcar de Barrameda]] with about 270 men on his expedition to circumnavigate the globe.
*[[1596]] &ndash; [[Diego de Montemayor]] founds the city of [[Monterrey]] in [[New Spain]].
*[[1697]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Rijswijk]] is signed by France, England, Spain, the [[Holy Roman Empire]] and the [[Dutch Republic]] ending the [[Nine Years' War]] (1688–97).
*[[1737]] &ndash; The finish of the [[Walking Purchase]] which forces the cession of 1.2 million acres (4,860&nbsp;km²) of [[Lenape|Lenape-Delaware]] tribal land to the [[Pennsylvania Colony]].
*[[1792]] &ndash; French troops stop allied invasion of France, during the [[War of the First Coalition]] at [[Battle of Valmy|Valmy]].
*[[1835]] &ndash; Ragamuffin rebels capture [[Porto Alegre]], then capital of the [[Empire of Brazil|Brazilian imperial]] province of [[Rio Grande do Sul]], triggering the start of ten-year-long [[Ragamuffin War]].
*[[1848]] &ndash; The [[American Association for the Advancement of Science]] is created.
*[[1854]] &ndash; [[Battle of Alma]]: British and French troops defeat Russians in the [[Crimea]].
*[[1857]] &ndash; The [[Indian Rebellion of 1857]] ends with the recapture of [[Delhi]] by troops loyal to the [[Honourable East India Company|East India Company]].
*[[1860]] &ndash; The [[Prince of Wales]] (later King [[Edward VII of the United Kingdom]]) visits the United States.
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The [[Battle of Chickamauga]] ends.
*[[1870]] &ndash; ''[[Bersaglieri]]'' corps [[capture of Rome|enter Rome]] through the ''[[Porta Pia]]'' and complete the [[Italian Unification|unification of Italy]].
*[[1871]] &ndash; [[Bishop]] [[John Coleridge Patteson]] is [[martyr]]ed on the island of [[Nukapu]], a [[Polynesian outlier]] island now in the [[Temotu Province]] of the [[Solomon Islands]]. He is the first bishop of [[Melanesia]].
*[[1881]] &ndash; [[Chester A. Arthur]] is inaugurated as the 21st [[President of the United States]] following the assassination of [[James Garfield]].
*[[1893]] &ndash; [[Charles Duryea]] and his brother road-test the first [[United States|America]]n-made [[gasoline]]-powered [[automobile]].
*[[1906]] &ndash; [[Cunard Line]]'s {{RMS|Mauretania|1906|6}} is launched at the [[Swan Hunter & Wigham Richardson]] shipyard in [[Newcastle upon Tyne]], England.
*[[1909]] &ndash; The [[Parliament of the United Kingdom]] passes the [[South Africa Act 1909]], creating the [[Union of South Africa]] from the British Colonies of the [[Cape Colony|Cape of Good Hope]], [[Colony of Natal|Natal]], [[Orange River Colony]], and the [[Transvaal Colony]].
*[[1910]] &ndash; The ocean liner {{SS|France|1910|6}}, later known as the "Versailles of the Atlantic", is launched.
*[[1911]] &ndash; [[White Star Line]]'s {{RMS|Olympic}} collides with British warship {{HMS|Hawke|1891|6}}.
*[[1920]] &ndash; Foundation of the [[Spanish Legion]].
*[[1930]] &ndash; [[Syro-Malankara Catholic Church]] is formed by [[Archbishop]] [[Mar Ivanios]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[The Holocaust|Holocaust]] in [[Letychiv]], [[Ukraine]]. In the course of two days the German [[Schutzstaffel|SS]] murders at least 3,000 [[Jews]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; The first [[Cannes Film Festival]] is held, having been delayed seven years due to World War II.
*[[1961]] &ndash; Greek general [[Konstantinos Dovas]] becomes [[List of Prime Ministers of Greece|Prime Minister of Greece]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; [[James Meredith]], an [[African-American]], is temporarily barred from entering the [[University of Mississippi]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; {{RMS|Queen Elizabeth 2||}} is launched at [[John Brown & Company]], [[Clydebank]], Scotland. It is operated by the [[Cunard Line]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[Syria]]n tanks roll into [[Jordan]] in response to continued fighting between Jordan and the [[fedayeen]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; Having weakened after making landfall in Nicaragua the previous day, [[Hurricane Irene–Olivia|Hurricane Irene]] regains enough strength to be renamed Hurricane Olivia, making it the first known hurricane to cross from the Atlantic Ocean into the Pacific.
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Billie Jean King]] beats [[Bobby Riggs]] in [[The Battle of the Sexes (tennis)|The Battle of the Sexes]] [[tennis]] match at the [[Reliant Astrodome|Houston Astrodome]] in [[Houston, Texas]].
*[[1977]] &ndash; The [[Vietnam|Socialist Republic of Vietnam]] is admitted to the [[United Nations]].
*[[1979]] &ndash; A ''[[coup d'état]]'' in the [[Central African Republic|Central African Empire]] overthrows Emperor [[Jean-Bédel Bokassa|Bokasa I]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; The [[National Football League]] players begin a 57-day strike.
*[[1984]] &ndash; A suicide bomber in a car attacks the U.S. [[embassy]] in [[Beirut]], [[Lebanon]], killing twenty-two people.
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[Capital gains tax]] is introduced in [[Australia]], one of a number of tax reforms by the Hawke/Keating government.
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[South Ossetia]] declares its independence from [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; The United Kingdom's [[MI6]] [[Secret Intelligence Service]] [[SIS Building|building]] is attacked by individuals using a Russian-built [[RPG-22]] anti-tank missile. The perpetrators remain unidentified.
*[[2001]] &ndash; In an address to a joint session of [[Congress of the United States|Congress]] and the American people, U.S. President [[George W. Bush]] declares a "[[war on terror]]".
*[[2002]] &ndash; The [[Kolka-Karmadon rock ice slide|Kolka-Karmadon rock/ice slide]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[2003 Maldives civil unrest|Maldives civil unrest]]: the death of prisoner [[Hassan Evan Naseem]] sparks a day of rioting in [[Malé]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; Between 15,000 and 20,000 protesters marched on [[Jena, Louisiana]], in support of [[Jena Six|six black youths]] who had been convicted of assaulting a white classmate.
*[[2008]] &ndash; A [[dump truck]] full of explosives [[Islamabad Marriott Hotel bombing|detonates]] in front of the [[Marriott International|Marriott]] hotel in [[Islamabad]], Pakistan, killing 54 people and injuring 266 others.
*[[2011]] &ndash; The United States ends its "[[don't ask, don't tell]]" policy, allowing gay men and women to serve openly for the first time.
